business.headline: Sensex crashes over 1,000 points. What's making D-Street bulls nervous?Stock market crash: The Sensex was down 1,018.81 points to 84,553.04 at 11:50 am and the Nifty50 tanked 290.20 points to trade at 25,888.75.

Ashneer Grover settles legal dispute with BharatPe, ends all company tiesThe resolution comes after a tumultuous period marked by allegations of financial misconduct against Ashneer Grover and his family during his tenure at BharatPe.

Mark Zuckerberg becomes world's fourth-richest person, enters $200 billion clubMark Zuckerberg's net worth has surged to $200 billion, positioning him as the fourth-richest person globally, right behind Amazon founder Jeff Bezos,, Tesla CEO Elon Musk and LVMH Chairman Bernard Arnault.
Income tax audit report deadline extended to October 7. Who benefits? Income tax audit report deadline: Originally set for September 30, 2024, the new deadline is now October 7, 2024.
Manba Finance shares list at 25% premium over IPO priceManba Finance IPO listing: Despite making a decent debut on the stock exchanges, the listing fell short of what the GMP had indicated.
Sensex slumps 700 points, Nifty falls below 26,000 amid profit bookingThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 685.85 points to 84,886 at 10:14 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 191.60 points to 25,987.35.

Modi vs Modi: The succession war brewing at Godfrey PhillipsAs the legal showdown unfolds, it's Modi vs Modi in a gripping battle that tests family bonds and determines the future of Godfrey Phillips India, highlighting ambition, legacy, and loyalty.

Meet Alakh Pandey, the young Edtech visionary behind Physics WallahFrom a humble tutor to a trailblazing entrepreneur, Alakh Pandey's journey with Physics Wallah shows how passion and perseverance can turn even the simplest beginnings into a $2.8 billion empire—reshaping education, one formula at a time.
Akriti Chopra, Zomato co-founder and Chief People's Officer, resignsIn an email to Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal, Akriti Chopra announced her decision to resign with immediate effect.
Explained: Why SJVN shares gained over 6% todayThe stock rose 6.03% to Rs 133.60 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), with a market capitalisation of Rs 52,520 crore.
Sensex, Nifty end lower after hitting record highs as financial stocks fallThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 264.27 points lower at 85,571.85, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 37.10 points lower at 26,178.95.

Swiggy files for Rs 10,000 crore IPO: Here's all you need to knowSwiggy's IPO will consist of two main parts: a fresh issue of equity shares worth Rs 3,750 crore, and an offer for sale (OFS) of 18.52 crore shares by existing stakeholders.

India once had a Rs 10,000 note. Know why it was discontinuedThe history of India's Rs 10,000 note dates back to the pre-independence era. In 1938, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) issued its first Rs 10,000 note, the largest denomination ever printed in the country.
What are multi-asset funds and are they good for your investment portfolio?Multi-asset funds are schemes that invest in a combination of three or more assets, such as equities, bonds, and gold.
China boosts exports: Will it hurt India, other global markets?With a slowing domestic economy, China is looking to global markets to absorb its excess production.

Real estate multibagger stock soars 260% in 1 year since IPO. Have you invested?Since its debut on the stock exchanges on September 27, 2023, the stock has outperformed not only its peers but also the broader real estate market.
Swipe, spend, struggle: How credit card defaults are spiking in IndiaOnce a symbol of freedom, credit cards now trap young Indians in growing debt. Could defaults be the new norm?

KRN Heat Exchanger IPO: Check latest GMP, subscription status, other detailsKRN Heat Exchanger opened for subscription on September 25 looking to raise Rs 341.95 crore from its public issue, and has already seen bids of over 80 times.

Accenture guidance boost lifts Infosys, Wipro; IT stocks rally up to 4%Accenture not only exceeded market expectations for its Q4 results but also raised its revenue guidance for FY25 to a range of 3-6%.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Amit Shah slams Mallikarjun Kharge over remarks on PM: Bitter display of spiteAmit Shah hit out at Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge for his statement about ousting PM Modi before dying, suggesting it reflects the "hatred and fear" the Congress has towards the Prime Minister.

Chief Justice says no to 'yeah' in court: This is not a coffee shopChief Justice DY Chandrachud took exception to a petitioner's use of the term "yeah" while addressing the bench during a hearing in the Supreme Court today.

US has robust military presence in Middle East to defend Israel: White HouseWhite House national security spokesman John Kirby expressed concern over escalating tensions in the Middle East but asserted Israel's right to eliminate the threat to its people and its land.

Ashneer Grover settles legal dispute with BharatPe, ends all company tiesThe resolution comes after a tumultuous period marked by allegations of financial misconduct against Ashneer Grover and his family during his tenure at BharatPe.

Mark Zuckerberg becomes world's fourth-richest person, enters $200 billion clubMark Zuckerberg's net worth has surged to $200 billion, positioning him as the fourth-richest person globally, right behind Amazon founder Jeff Bezos,, Tesla CEO Elon Musk and LVMH Chairman Bernard Arnault.

Ground Report: Here's how currency is exchanged at Lebanon-Syria borderUnlike in other countries, people from both Lebanon and Syria can easily exchange currency near the border informally. People crossing over to the other side of the border can exchange currency from civilians at the market exchange rate.

Delhi Chief Minister Atishi assures 'pothole-free' Diwali, inspects roadsAccording to the Delhi Chief Minister, after one week of inspection of the 1,400-km stretch of PWD roads, it will be decided which roads need "complete repair", "partial repair" and which need to be rebuilt. Repair work will begin the week after the inspection.

SpaceX Crew-9, Sunita Williams' new ride home, arrives at space stationNasa's decision to switch Williams and Wilmore to SpaceX has extended their mission on the ISS by several months. Originally scheduled to return after an eight-day mission, they will now remain on the station until late February.

Assault case against activist who took Siddaramaiah to court in Muda caseA woman in Karnataka's Mysuru district accused RTI activist Snehamayi Krishna and three others of assault and harassment over a property dispute. A case was lodged based on her complaint.

4 killed in Israeli strike on building in Beirut, 1st attack inside city limits Live UpdatesAs Israel continued to strike Lebanon, the Health Ministry in Beirut claimed that at least 105 people were killed in the attacks in the past 24 hours.

Anupam Kher's face on fake currency notes, actor says 'anything can happen' Counterfeit currency notes featuring Anupam Kher's face were seized in Gujarat. The actor responded to the news by sharing a video online, expressing his surprise.

Moon's temperature dipped as Earth went into Covid lockdownA groundbreaking study by Indian researchers, published in the Monthly Notices of the Royal Astronomical Society: Letters, reveals that lunar nighttime temperatures experienced an anomalous dip.

Mithun Chakraborty to be honoured with Dadasaheb Phalke AwardActor Mithun Chakraborty, who made his acting debut with the art house drama Mrigayaa (1976), will soon be honoured with the Dadasaheb Phalke Award. He will receive the award at the 70th National Film Awards ceremony on October 8.

Bihar floods: Schools, power grid inundated, 6 barrages breached in 24 hoursHeavy rain in Nepal's catchment areas has caused many rivers in Bihar to flow at or above danger levels in several bordering districts, affecting thousands of people.
BookMyShow CEO summoned again over black marketing of Coldplay concert ticketsBookMyShow CEO Ashish Hemrajani has been asked to appear today before the investigating officer to record his statement.

Video: YouTuber Gaurav Taneja's wife Ritu shares 'reality' after separation rumours"Reality," Ritu Rathee captioned her post, in which she addressed separation rumours and asked social media users to refrain from interfering in their personal matters.

Boy, 5, gang-raped in Uttar Pradesh's Hapur, bystanders record videoThe accused took the boy from his home to a nearby field and then gang-raped him. Two goat herders, who were present in the field, recorded a video and also shared it on the internet, the child's family said in its complaint.

Ground Report: Beirut remains tense after Israeli strikes hit Lebanon's capitalFour people from the Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine (PFLP) were killed on Sunday after Israel conducted its first strike within Beirut's city limits, escalating hostilities against Iran's allies in the region. After the attack by Israel in the Kola district of Lebanon's capital, India Today's Ashraf Wani reached the spot to bring out the latest updates from the spot. This is the first time that Israel targeted a political party of Sunni Muslims in Lebanon since the outbreak of the war last year. In the attack, the building sustained significant damage and people were also asked to vacate the area soon after the attack. As many as 50 cars were also damaged in the attack by Israel. According to Lebanon's Health Ministry, more than 1,000 Lebanese have been killed and 6,000 wounded in the past two weeks, without saying how many were civilians. The government said a million people - a fifth of the population - have fled their homes.

Tripura woman allegedly tied to tree, burnt alive by sons, family dispute suspectedTwo people were arrested in West Tripura for allegedly tying their mother to a tree and burning her alive. The police suspect that a family dispute might have led to the gruesome murder.
IndiGo passengers yell at airport ground staff over delayed flight. Video is viralThe viral video showed IndiGo passengers lashing out at female ground staff near the boarding gate.

YouTube blocks songs by Adele, Bob Dylan and other famous singers in US: Here is what happened YouTube has blocked songs by artists like Adele, Bob Dylan, Green Day, and Burna Boy in the US due to a legal dispute with SESAC. The platform is working to resolve the issue, but no clear timeline has been provided.

Industrialist SP Oswal duped of Rs 7 crore by cyber criminals, 2 arrestedA complaint was filed by the Vardhman Group alleging that their CMD SP Oswal was duped by unidentified cyber criminals for Rs 7 crore. Two people were arrested by the Ludhiana Police in connection with the case and efforts are being made to arrest seven other members of the gang.

ACs at Madhya Pradesh hospital non-functional, patients bring their own fansThe ICU of the government-run Seth Govind Das Victoria District Hospital is in a dire condition, with its AC not functioning since the last four months.

Rohit Shetty's Singham Again earns Rs 200 crore weeks before grand Diwali releaseRohit Shetty and Jio Studios have sold the non-theatrical rights of Singham Again for a whopping Rs 200 crore. The Ajay Devgn-starrer is now looking at a wide release this Diwali.

Anupam Kher's face on fake currency notes, actor says 'anything can happen' Counterfeit currency notes featuring Anupam Kher's face were seized in Gujarat. The actor responded to the news by sharing a video online, expressing his surprise.

Bigg Boss 18: Nia Sharma first confirmed contestant on Salman Khan's showTV actor Nia Sharma is the first confirmed contestant for Bigg Boss 18, as revealed on Khatron Ke Khiladi 14 finale by Rohit Shetty. The show is premiering on October 6.

Nagarjuna gives shout-out to Karthi's Meiyazhagan: Went to sleep with a smileNagarjuna gave a shout-out to Karthi and Arvind Swami's Meiyazhagan (Sathyam Sundaram in Telugu). He congratulated the team and mentioned that the film brought back his childhood memories.

sports.headline: Watch: Rohit Sharma takes stunning one-handed catch, wows Shubman GillIndia vs Bangladesh, Kanpur Test: Rohit Sharma came up with a sensational fielding effort. The India captain took a one-handed catch to dismiss Bangladesh wicketkeeper-batter Litton Das on Monday in Kanpur.

Players provoking fans should be sanctioned: Simeone after Madrid derby fiascoAtletico Madrid boss Diego Simeone has claimed that players who provoke fans should also be sanctioned after the unrest in the Wanda Metropolitano during the Madrid derby on Sunday, September 29.

VVS Laxman lauds India women's team's unmatched preparationFormer India batter VVS Laxman has lauded the India women's cricket team for their rigorous preparation ahead of the Women's T20 World Cup. Laxman highlighted the commitment and intensity shown by the team under the guidance of head coach Amol Muzumdar.

Watch: Pakistan's Iftikhar loses his cool at media after Champions Cup finalPakistan's Iftikhar Ahmed has lambasted the media for overhyping young cricketers after just one good performance, following his team's Champions Cup final loss. Iftikhar stressed the importance of allowing players to prove themselves in domestic cricket before making international claims.

Jasprit Bumrah reiterates love for Test cricket: My favourite formatJasprit Bumrah has reiterated his love for Test cricket and said it is his favourite format. Bumrah has been India's joint-highest wicket-taker in Tests this year.

Sri Lanka not looking too far ahead: Dhananjaya de Silva on WTC final prospectsSri Lanka's Test captain Dhananjaya de Silva emphasizes focusing on immediate goals despite the team's rapid rise in the WTC standings. With crucial tours ahead, de Silva aims to maintain the team's momentum without looking too far ahead.

England played new brand of cricket well: Harry Brook after Australia series lossHarry Brook has claimed that England played the new brand of cricket well despite their series loss to Australia on September 29, Sunday. England suffered a major collapse in the 5th ODI loss against Australia.

Every time Pakistan lost to India in 1990s, people thought match was fixed: Nazar Former Pakistan cricketer Mudassar Nazar opens up about the immense pressure and match-fixing suspicions faced by the team in the early 1990s. He reveals the psychological impact of these suspicions, especially during matches against arch-rival India.

Manchester United boss Erik ten Hag unconcerned about future after Spurs lossManchester United boss Erik ten Hag said that he isn't thinking about his future at the club despite their recent loss to Tottenham Hotspur on September 29, Sunday.

Real Madrid manager Ancelotti disappointed after 1-1 derby draw at AtleticoReal Madrid manager Carlo Ancelotti was frustrated after his team let hosts Atletico Madrid salvage a 1-1 draw with a goal late into extra time in their LaLiga match on Sunday.

England played new brand of cricket well: Harry Brook after Australia series lossHarry Brook has claimed that England played the new brand of cricket well despite their series loss to Australia on September 29, Sunday. England suffered a major collapse in the 5th ODI loss against Australia.

He reveals the psychological impact of these suspicions, especially during matches against arch-rival India.

Real Madrid manager Ancelotti disappointed after 1-1 derby draw at AtleticoReal Madrid manager Carlo Ancelotti was frustrated after his team let hosts Atletico Madrid salvage a 1-1 draw with a goal late into extra time in their LaLiga match on Sunday.

Varun Chakravarthy earns second chance to prove his worth for IndiaIndia vs Bangladesh: Varun Chakravarthy has made a remarkable return to the Indian T20I team for the series against Bangladesh. The 33-year-old mystery spinner's journey back into the squad is a story of perseverance and determination.

Adair brothers lead Ireland to historic T20I win vs South Africa, level seriesIreland vs South Africa: Adair brothers produced a dominant performance to help Ireland secure their first-ever T20I win over South Africa in the second match of the series.

Pressure rises on Erik Ten Hag as Tottenham romp Manchester United 3-0Tottenham beat Manchester United 3-0 and climbed to eighth in the table on 10 points after six games. On the other hand United are 12th with seven points that will again raise questions about manager Erik ten Hag.

T20 World Cup: Jemimah, Vastrakar star as India beat West Indies in warm-upsThe Indian team started off their warm-up fixtures with an emphatic 20-run win over West Indies in Dubai. Jemimah Rodrigues scored 52 and Pooja Vastrakar took 3 wickets to help India win.

ENG vs AUS: Head, Short script series win for Australia in rain curtailed 5th ODIAustralia beat England by 49 runs through the DLS method in the fifth ODI of the series to clinch the series by 3-2. Travis Head was adjudged both Player of the Match and Player of the Series.

IPL Retention Rules Explained: Player-friendly and pleasing franchisesThe BCCI announced the retention and auction rules ahead of the mega auction for IPL 2025. India Today's Akshay Ramesh and Alan John give you a detailed account of the rules laid out.
Duleep Trophy likely to return to zonal format from next seasonThe Duleep Trophy is likely to return to its zonal format after the four team competition played in the 2023-24 season.

Wasn't expecting a full-toss: David Miller on Hardik's final over in T20 World CupDavid Miller revealed that he was not expecting a full-toss from Hardik Pandya in the final over of the T20 World Cup 2024. He felt that he let his country and teammates down at that time.

ENG vs AUS: Head, Short script series win for Australia in rain curtailed 5th ODIAustralia beat England by 49 runs through the DLS method in the fifth ODI of the series to clinch the series by 3-2. Travis Head was adjudged both Player of the Match and Player of the Series.

IPL Retention Rules Explained: Player-friendly and pleasing franchisesThe BCCI announced the retention and auction rules ahead of the mega auction for IPL 2025. India Today's Akshay Ramesh and Alan John give you a detailed account of the rules laid out.
Duleep Trophy likely to return to zonal format from next seasonThe Duleep Trophy is likely to return to its zonal format after the four team competition played in the 2023-24 season.

Wasn't expecting a full-toss: David Miller on Hardik's final over in T20 World CupDavid Miller revealed that he was not expecting a full-toss from Hardik Pandya in the final over of the T20 World Cup 2024. He felt that he let his country and teammates down at that time.

IND vs BAN 2nd Test Kanpur Weather Report: Is Play possible on Day 4?The Days 2 and 3 of the ongoing second Test between India and Bangladesh were washed out due to rain and wet outfield leaving fans wondering whether they will get to see some action on Day 4.

Litchfield, Harris miss warm-ups as Australia face injury scare  Women's T20 World Cup 2024: Australia have had a couple of injury scares after Grace Harris and Phoebe Litchfield missed both their warm-up matches.

Happy Birthday Richu: Indian women's team celebrate ahead of T20 World CupThe Indian team celebrated Richa Ghosh's 21st birthday as she was smeared with cake, followed by a little tea party. Harmanpreet Kaur-led side will begin their campaign from October 4.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
